Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இன்மையின் இன்னாது உடைமை முறைசெய்யா மன்னவன் கோற்கீழ்ப் படின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Property gives more sorrow than poverty, to those who live under the sceptre of a king without justice.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split scene. On the left, a poor but free person ('இன்மை') is shown with very few possessions, but they have a look of simple peace.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a wealthy person ('உடைமை') lives under the rule of an unjust king. The king's crooked sceptre casts a dark, menacing shadow over the wealthy person's house. The wealthy person looks terrified, knowing that their property can be unjustly seized at any moment.
Layered_Composition.Background: The wealthy person's possessions are depicted not as a comfort, but as a source of anxiety—golden chains that bind them and treasures that attract the tyrant's gaze. This makes their situation worse than poverty ('இன்மையின் இன்னாது').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: To have wealth under a tyrant is a worse, more sorrowful state than to have poverty in a just world.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The shadow of the crooked sceptre falling over the rich person's house is a key symbol of threat. The wealth depicted as chains represents the burden and anxiety it causes under tyranny.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Anxious, insecure, fearful, worse than poverty.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The poor person's side is simple but has a calm, neutral light. The wealthy person's side is filled with the cold glint of gold but is dominated by the dark, oppressive shadow of the sceptre.

Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a strong focus on the contrasting emotions of the two central figures.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast, symbolic lighting, especially for the menacing shadow.

Cultural_Anchors: Wealth under a Tyrant ('முறைசெய்யா மன்னவன் கோற்கீழ் உடைமை')
